title: Yi's Q should not make him invulnerable
body: I think it's just stupid that if Yi Q's you, there's literally NOTHING you can do to him in that time period. The only counter play to it is Zonyas.

replies.body:
It doesn't make him invulnerable; it makes him untargetable.

He still takes damage from pre-applied DoT abilities like Ignite, Torment, Malefic Visions, and red buff.
You're right, but I don't think he was meaning the technical term.
So you want to remove the only skilled aspect of master Yi? --'

> I think it's just stupid that if Yi Q's you, there's literally NOTHING you can do to him in that time period. The only counter play to it is Zonyas.

He is a champion that relies on auto attacks, that small second of safety (being able to avoid cc / damage) is the only way he could ever hope to be viable.

When a Yi alpha's one of your key abilities (cc), you were out played (as much as I hate saying that). When to alpha and not to alpha is basically all that distinguishes average, good and great Yi players.

> [{quoted}](name=Kat  Head,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vjOfOlcA,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-09-27T16:59:38.715+0000)

> When a Yi alpha's one of your key abilities (cc), you were out played (as much as I hate saying that). When to alpha and not to alpha is basically all that distinguishes average, good and great Yi players.

Except for all those other auto reliant champions who have no invulnerability and do just fine. You don't get "outplayed" by point and click abilities. That's the cringiest fucking thing I've heard all day.

I wish it worked similar to Vlad's puddle escape. Where if I target him and he does it, my stun doesn't automatically go on cooldown. 

The amount of times I've messed up my only stun (cause Pantheon's W is on a longer cooldown than Yi's Q I believe) and died before I could do it again just irks me. I need to time it better, but I still hate Alpha strike.

Yi can never be allowed to be strong. His kit allows for too much with too little, and the only reasonable way to balance him would be to give him less means of mitigating the damage he takes. Why? Because it will never, ever be comparable to the damage he puts out. Ever. And this is what he does, right? Yi does damage, that makes sense. 

At the very least, Q does not need a cooldown reduction mechanic.
